title: 112_hr2867
content:
The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes that each member of the Commission shall serve a 2-year term and may not serve more than 2 terms. Members who have completed 2 full terms will have their term expire 90 days after such date. The Act establishes that Commission members must attend at least 75% of meetings to be eligible for reappointment. Additionally, members cannot serve as Chair for more than one consecutive term. Commission members are also subject to federal travel regulations. SEC. 3. APPLICATION OF ANTIDISCRIMINATION LAWS.
    Amends Section 204 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 to include protections against employment discrimination, fair labor standards, employee rights, and protections for Commission employees. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.
    Amends Section 207(a) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2012 through 2014.
SEC. 5. STANDARDS OF CONDUCT AND DISCLOSURE.
    Amends Section 208 of the Act to increase the threshold for financial disclosure to $250,000 and change the reference from "International Relations" to "Foreign Affairs".
SEC. 6. TERMINATION.
    Amends Section 209 to change the termination date from September 30, 2011. SEC. 7. REPORT ON EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS TO PROMOTE RELIGIOUS FREEDOM.
The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on the implementation of this Act and its amendments within 1 year of enactment. The report will assess the effectiveness of U.S. Government programs promoting international religious freedom, review the Office on International Religious Freedom's role, and examine the Ambassador at Large's responsibilities. The curr_chunk discusses a review of the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom's role, the goals of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, a comparative analysis of its structure, and the relationship between the Ambassador and the Commission. The curr_chunk defines the term "appropriate congressional committees" as per the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The curr_chunk describes the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
